text: a lettuce cup is a great vehicle for all
manner of food and this recipe is
chicken artichoke and orzo and lettuce
cups generously solve a pot of boiling

like rice but it's actually pasta the
orzo will take about 7 minutes while
it's cooking make your dressing this is
a very simple dressing here i have a
shallot that i'm going to mince what
about 2 tablespoons that looks about
right into the bowl it goes and 2

equipments here and that goes in and
joins the shout their lemon zest and
juice use a microplane grater to get a

juice this is a small little lemon here
so I think I'll need the whole thing and
this isn't one of my favorite tools at
least in the kitchen I have a few a
small sieve to catch the seed rather
than bothering with a juice or any of
that kind of equipment and five
tablespoons of olive oil goes in I'm
making this dressing now while the pasta
cooks because I want to dress the pasta
when it's hot what it'll do is it will
absorb all of the flavors of this
dressing and make it so delicious pastas
ready to drain and I've already got a
colander in the sink be sure all the
waters drained off the pasta before you
dress it you don't want a watery lettuce
cup ok this is ready for dressing orzo
goes in and just eyeball half of this
and give this a good toss this is
looking good and while this cools down
we can work on our chicken and
artichokes now for a little slicing and

chicken breasts so these are boneless

like this and in a nice clean motion
back and forth right to the center it's
like opening a book and then we're just
going to separate it there and again
with the other breast it's actually
really easy once you get the hang of it
and you can of course by these already
and cutlets at the butcher but they
charge you a lot more per pound to do

cook very quickly
in the pan so I want to pound them to
about a quarter of an inch thickness
making sure they're even okay salt and
pepper these are ready for cooking heat
a large skillet over medium-high swirlin
about a tablespoon of olive oil once
that Oriole shimmers in the pan the
chicken can go in this cooks in a flat
one to two minutes per side and is ready
to go we want the chicken to see you're
not steam once the chicken becomes
opaque along the side that's a good
indication that it's ready to flip has a
nice golden color these are looking
fantastic transfer them to a plate to
rest and leave that fire under the
skillet artichokes are going to go right
in this is ten ounces of artichoke
hearts that have been quartered and they
go right into the skillet and what
they're going to do is pick up all that
great chicken flavor as they cook these
are frozen and thawed it's important to
Pat them dry so that they don't steam in
the skillet you're really looking just
to warm them through and have them get a
little bit of golden color and we're
ready to put it all together add the
artichoke hearts to the orzo and stir
that about and really all that's left to
do now is shred the chicken all right so
this should be nice and cool by now it's
been sitting for a few minutes
beautifully cooked you can do this with
two forks I like to use my hands here
it's quick so this goes in with the

in because I want all of those juices

going to inform the flavor the rest of
the dressing goes in now now you can

all you need are your lettuce cups and I
